w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach names of extreme sports by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: extreme sports, fall, risks, What is a risk, He is hurt, dangerous, I feel thrilled, land, water, air, What sport is this, This is ___, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing,
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for extreme sports
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: risks, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about extreme sports!”

with a pained face. Have the child repeat the action and the word.

Circle each picture and make a scared and nervous face to show the meaning of the word,
Circle the first picture and ask, “What is the risk?” Explain and show that the person on the blocks can FALL. Explain that falling is a risk.
Circle the last two pictures and ask, “What is the risk?” Encourage the child to answer,

and make a big smile on your face.

with a big smile. Have the child repeat.
Say, the three main places we can do extreme sports
Match the sports to the place you do them by drawing a line
Circle the first place and say the name,
Have the child say the word. Repeat with water and air.
Spell the three words one at a time and have the child repeat.

Explain that we skateboard on land. Encourage the child to draw lines from the place to the extreme sport.
Have the child repeat. Do the action for
by pretending to jump and open your arms like the people in the picture.
Ask, “What is the RISK?” Go back to slide 4 and explain that risk can be when you get hurt or fall.
Circle the picture again and ask, “What sport is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence,
Have the child repeat. Do the action for
by holding your arms out and pretending to roll on the skateboard.
Ask, “What is the RISK?” Go back to slide 4 and explain that risk can be when you get hurt or fall.
Circle the picture again and ask, “What sport is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence,
Say the name of two land extreme sports
Tell which extreme sport you like
We play these sports on the land.
Circle one of the sports. Ask, “What sport is this?” Encourage child to answer in a complete sentence,
This is skateboarding, This is parkour.
Ask, “What is the RISK?” Encourage the child to answer about the risk.

Say the name of each extreme sport in a sentence.
Encourage the child to draw a line from the other pictures and use each sport in a complete sentence.
Ask, “What is the RISK?” Encourage the child to answer about the risk.
Circle the picture again and ask, “What sport is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence,
Ask, “What is the RISK?” Encourage the child to answer about the risk.
Circle the picture again and ask, “What sport is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence,
Draw a line from the extreme sport to the equipment you need for the sport.
Say the name of each water sport.

Circle the skis in the first picture. Ask, “What is she using?” Draw a line from the first picture to the water skis. Say the name of the sport in a complete sentence. Have the child repeat. Encourage the child to do the same with the other two pictures.
Say the name of each extreme sport.
Use each extreme sport in a complete sentence
Circle one sport at a time. Ask the child,
Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence.
Draw a line from the location to the extreme sport.
Model drawing a lie from the location to the extreme sport.

risks, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing

Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
risks, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
risks, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
risks, parkour, skateboarding, bungee jumping, hang gliding, surfing, water skiing
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
